stem: The nurse is caring for a client with severe ARDS on a high-PEEP ventilator protocol. Based on the documentation in the Ventilator Observation Flowsheet, match each setting to its specific physiological intent.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
08:00: Client (44y/o female) with COVID-19 related ARDS. Currently paralyzed and sedated. 
08:30: SpO2 has dropped to 86% despite FiO2 of 0.80. 
09:00: Provider orders an increase in PEEP to 18 cm H2O and a decrease in Tidal Volume to 4 mL/kg. 
09:30: Peak inspiratory pressures (PIP) are 38 cm H2O; Plateau pressure is 28 cm H2O.

tabs.title: Ventilator Observation Flowsheet
tabs.content:
SettingCurrent ValueObservation
FiO20.90 (90%)Refractory hypoxemia noted
PEEP18 cm H2OImproved alveolar recruitment
Tidal Volume (Vt)250 mLLow-volume strategy implemented
Plateau Pressure28 cm H2OMaintaining < 30 goal

tabs.title: ABG Stats
tabs.content: PaO2: 64 mmHg | PaCO2: 52 mmHg | pH: 7.28 | P/F Ratio: 71

rationale.correct: PEEP (r1) keeps alveoli open at the end of expiration (c1). Low tidal volume (r2) prevents over-distension of the lungs (c2). Conservative fluids (r3) reduce the 'wetness' of the lungs in ARDS (c3). FiO2 (r4) is the immediate concentration adjustment to treat low oxygen (c4).
clinicalPearls: In ARDS, oxygen isn't the only fix; you must provide PRESSURE to open the fluid-filled alveoli.
VILI (Ventilator-Induced Lung Injury) is a major cause of death in ARDS.
Goal Plateau Pressure is < 30 cm H2O.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking PEEP fixes the CO2 level.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: PEEP primarily affects Oxygenation (PaO2). RR and Tidal Volume primarily affect CO2 removal.
